article.headline: Mercer 61, Kennesaw St. 57
article.story: KENNESAW, Ga. -- Jakob Gollon scored 17 points and Mercer rallied to defeat Kennesaw State 61-57 Friday night for its ninth straight win and first 20-win season in nine years. The Bears (20-7, 12-2 Atlantic Sun Conference) used a 13-2 run to turn a six-point deficit with 13:26 remaining into a five-point lead, then held on to deny the Owls (3-23, 0-14) their first league victory. Kennesaw State got to 53-52 on a Spencer Dixon 3-pointer with 5:14 left, but could not pull ahead. There were four lead changes in the first half, with Mercer leading 27-24 at the break. The Bears outshot the Owls 55.8 percent (24 of 43) to 32.1 percent (18 of 56) to sweep the season series, having won 81-51 on Jan. 13. Bud Thomas added 14 points, Monty Brown 12 and Langston Hall 11 for Mercer. Dixon's 19 points paced Kennesaw State, which has lost 14 straight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
